question: I just got out of the hospital r/t overnight orbitl edema increasing my eye pressure to 35 and rectus muscle to be 3 times the norm and swelled eye up where I could not open it up. I had strep throat for the first time in my life at 47 years old a week prior to this.  Medical teams were dissagreeing as to what this was  r/t CT scans or how it happened.  Periorbital cellulitis? Inflammation or infection. I was treated with heavy duty ABT x 2 days but then edema continued (only in left eye) and I was awake two nights with severe headaches ( unrelieved by Morphine or Lortabs) I would contribute that to increased edema.   Finally one of the eye Dr's was called to evaluate me the second morning and high doses of steroids were ordered.  In just two hours my headache was dissappearing.  I was told I have hyperthyroidism. My labs were slightly elevated and one Dr. said it may be that way because this happened and could return to normal. I have always had an enlarged thyroid and had it checked many times before but was never told I had this problem.  I find this very wierd r/t it only happened to one eye.  I have been placed on Flexeril, Methocarbamol and tylenol 3 prior to this incident for and injury to Left shoulder and neck possibly a compressed nerve (pending and MRI prior to this incident).   I am a person who never gets sick.  What a chain of events recently! Could my injury have anything to do with this? The medications? Anyone with answers or thoughts I would love to hear them.
title: Quick overnight severe orbital edema, rectus muscle edema?
